concise_definition: v. 画, 拉, 吸引, 抽取; n. 平局, 抽签

definitions.explanation_en: To make a picture or diagram using a pencil, pen, or other instrument; to create visual representations.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用铅笔、钢笔或其他工具绘制图画或图表；创作视觉形象。
definitions.example_en: She draws beautiful landscapes in her sketchbook every weekend.
definitions.example_cn: 她每个周末都在速写本上画美丽的风景。

definitions.explanation_en: To pull or attract something or someone toward oneself, often with force or influence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用力量或吸引力将某物或某人拉向自己，常指物理或抽象的吸引。
definitions.example_en: The magician draws a crowd wherever he performs.
definitions.example_cn: 这位魔术师无论到哪里表演都会吸引一大群观众。

definitions.explanation_en: To take or obtain something from a source, such as drawing water from a well or drawing money from an account.
definitions.explanation_cn: 从某处取出或获取某物，例如从井中取水或从账户中取款。
definitions.example_en: He draws his salary on the first of every month.

definitions.explanation_en: A tie or result in a game or competition where no side wins; a situation of equal outcome.
definitions.explanation_cn: 比赛中双方得分相等、无人获胜的结果；平局。
definitions.example_en: The final match ended in a 2-2 draw.

definitions.explanation_en: The act of selecting something randomly, such as a lottery draw or a draw for team assignments.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过随机方式选出某物的行为，如彩票抽奖或抽签分配队伍。
definitions.example_en: The winner of the prize will be announced after the draw tomorrow.
definitions.example_cn: 奖品得主将在明天的抽签后公布。

comparison.analysis: “Sketch” (草图) 指快速、简略的绘画，通常未完成，用于记录想法或初步构图。而 “draw” 是更广泛的动词，涵盖从草图到精细画作的所有绘画行为，强调动作本身，而 “sketch” 更强调结果的粗糙性。
“Attract” (吸引) 是一个更通用的抽象动词，用于描述任何引起兴趣或注意的行为，如吸引注意力、吸引投资。而 “draw” 在表示吸引时，常带有更强的物理或视觉隐喻，如人群被吸引到某个地点，语气更形象、生动。
“Tie” (平局) 作为名词时与 “draw” 在体育语境中可互换，但 “tie” 更常用于美式英语，而 “draw” 是英式英语的主流用法。此外，”tie“ 也可作动词，表示系紧，语义范围更广；而 ”draw“ 作为名词仅限于竞赛结果或抽签。
